info.title: Contentstack Content Management API OpenAPI Specification
info.description:
Contentstack provides a set of read-write APIs that enables you to interact with the information and perform any tasks within your Contentstack account. You can create/edit/delete entries and assets, manage Content Types, etc., using these APIs.

Contentstack provides an OpenAPI JSON file that consists of a set of preconfigured REST API requests that will make it easy for you to get started with the Contentstack Management APIs and try out our API requests through the Swagger Editor.

CMA OpenAPI Details

Version: 1.0.0
Last Updated: Jan 22, 2021

get.description:
The Get user call returns comprehensive information of an existing user account. The information returned includes details of the stacks owned by and shared with the specified user account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get User API Reference document

put.description:
The Update User API Request updates the details of an existing user account. Only the information entered here will be updated, the existing data will remain unaffected.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Update User API Reference document

requestBody.description:
The Update User API Request updates the details of an existing user account. Only the information entered here will be updated, the existing data will remain unaffected.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Update User API Reference document

post.description:
The Activate a user account call activates the account of a user after signing up. For account activation, you will require the token received in the activation email.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Activate User API Reference document

requestBody.description:
The Activate a user account call activates the account of a user after signing up. For account activation, you will require the token received in the activation email.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Activate User API Reference document

post.description:
The Request for a password call sends a request for a temporary password to log in to an account in case a user has forgotten the login password.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Request Password API Reference document

requestBody.description:
The Request for a password call sends a request for a temporary password to log in to an account in case a user has forgotten the login password.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Request Password API Reference document

post.description:
The Reset password call sends a request for resetting the password of your Contentstack account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Reset Password API Reference document

requestBody.description:
The Reset password call sends a request for resetting the password of your Contentstack account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Reset Password API Reference document

post.description:
The Log in to your account request is used to sign in to your Contentstack account and obtain the authtoken.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Logging in/out API Reference document

requestBody.description:
The Log in to your account request is used to sign in to your Contentstack account and obtain the authtoken.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Logging in/out API Reference document

delete.description:
The Log out of your account call is used to sign out the user of Contentstack account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Logging in/out API Reference document

get.description:
The Get all organizations call lists all organizations related to the system user in the order that they were created.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get All Organizations API Reference document

The Get a single organization call gets the comprehensive details of a specific organization related to the system user.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get Single Organization API Reference document

get.summary: Get all roles in an Organization
get.description:
The Get all roles in an organization call gives the details of all the roles that are set to users in an Organization.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Organization Roles API Reference document

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The ‘limit’ parameter will return a specific number of Organization roles in the output. Example, if there are 10 organization roles and you wish to fetch only the first 2, you need to specify '2' as the value in this parameter.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The ‘skip’ parameter will skip a specific number of Organization roles in the output. For example, if there are 12 organization roles and you want to skip the first 2 to get only the last 10 in the response body, you need to specify ‘2’ here.

parameters.name: asc
parameters.description: The ‘asc’ parameter allows you to sort the list of organization roles in an ascending order on the basis of a parameter.

parameters.name: desc
parameters.description: The ‘desc’ parameter allows you to sort the list of organization roles in a descending order on the basis of a parameter.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: The ‘include_count’ parameter returns the total number of roles in an organization. For example: If you want to know the total number of roles in an organization, you need to mention ‘true’.

post.description:
The Add users to organization call allows you to send invitations to add users to your organization. Only the owner or the admin of the organization can add users.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Organization Users API Reference document

requestBody.description:
The Add users to organization call allows you to send invitations to add users to your organization. Only the owner or the admin of the organization can add users.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Organization Users API Reference document

get.description:
The Get all organization invitations call gives you a list of all the Organization invitations. Only the owner or the admin of the Organization can resend the invitation to add users to an Organization.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Organization Users API Reference document

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The ‘limit’ parameter will return a specific number of sent organization invitations in the output. Example, if 10 invitations were sent out and you wish to fetch only the first 8, you need to specify '2' as the value in this parameter.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The ‘skip’ parameter will skip a specific number of organization roles in the output. Example, if there are 12 organization roles and you want to skip the last 2 to get only the first 10 in the response body, you need to specify ‘2’ here.

parameters.name: asc
parameters.description: The ‘asc’ parameter allows you to sort the list of organization invitations in ascending order on the basis of a specific parameter.

parameters.name: desc
parameters.description: The ‘desc’ parameter allows you to sort the list of organization invitations in descending order on the basis of a specific parameter.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: The ‘include_count’ parameter returns the total number of organization invitations sent out. Example: If you wish to know the total number of organization invitations, you need to mention ‘true’.

parameters.name: typeahead
parameters.description: The ‘typeahead’ parameter allows you to perform a name-based search on all the stacks on an organization based on the value provided. For example, it allows you to perform an email-ID-based search on all users based on the email ID provided.

get.description:
The Resend pending organization invitation call allows you to resend Organization invitations to users who have not yet accepted the earlier invitation. Only the owner or the admin of the Organization can resend the invitation to add users to an Organization.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Organization Users API Reference document

post.description:
The Transfer organization ownership call transfers the ownership of an Organization to another user. When the call is executed, an email invitation for accepting the ownership of a particular Organization is sent to the specified user.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Transfer Organization Ownership API Reference document

requestBody.description:
The Transfer organization ownership call transfers the ownership of an Organization to another user. When the call is executed, an email invitation for accepting the ownership of a particular Organization is sent to the specified user.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Transfer Organization Ownership API Reference document

get.summary: Get all stacks in an Organization
get.description:
The Get all stacks in an organization call fetches the list of all stacks in an Organization.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Organization Stacks API Reference document

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The ‘limit’ parameter will return a specific number of stacks in the output. Example, if there are 10 organization stacks and you wish to fetch only the first 2, you need to specify '2' as value in this parameter.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The ‘skip’ parameter will skip a specific number of organization stacks in the output. Example, if there are 12 stacks and you want to skip the last 2 to get only the first 10 in the response body, you need to specify ‘2’ here.

parameters.name: asc
parameters.description: The ‘asc’ parameter allows you to sort the list of stacks in an organization in the ascending order.

parameters.name: desc
parameters.description: The ‘desc’ parameter allows you to sort the list of stacks in an organization in the descending order.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: The ‘include_count’ parameter returns the total number of stacks in an organization. Example: If you wish to know the total number of stacks in your organization, you need to mention ‘true’.

parameters.name: typeahead
parameters.description: The ‘typeahead’ parameter allows you to perform a name-based search on all the stacks on an organization based on the value provided.

get.description:
The Get organization log details request is used to retrieve the audit log details of an organization.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Organization Logs API Reference document

The Get organization log item request is used to retrieve a specific item from the audit log of an organization.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Organization Logs API Reference document

The Get a single stack call fetches comprehensive details of a specific stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get Single Stack API Reference document

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include in the response the total count of the stacks owned by or shared with a user account.

post.description:
The Create stack call creates a new stack in your Contentstack account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Create Stack API Reference document

requestBody.description:
The Create stack call creates a new stack in your Contentstack account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Create Stack API Reference document

put.description:
The Update stack call lets you update the name and description of an existing stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Update Stack API Reference document

requestBody.description:
The Update stack call lets you update the name and description of an existing stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Update Stack API Reference document

delete.description:
The Delete stack call is used to delete an existing stack permanently from your Contentstack account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Delete stack API Reference document

get.summary: Get all users of a stack
get.description:
The Get all users of a stack call fetches the list of all users of a particular stack

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get all users API Reference document.

post.description:
The Update User Role API Request updates the roles of an existing user account. This API Request will override the existing roles assigned to a user. For example, we have an existing user with the "Developer" role, and if you execute this API request with "Content Manager" role, the user role will lose "Developer" rights and the user role be updated to just "Content Manager".

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Update Existing User Role API Reference document

requestBody.description:
The Update User Role API Request updates the roles of an existing user account. This API Request will override the existing roles assigned to a user. For example, we have an existing user with the "Developer" role, and if you execute this API request with "Content Manager" role, the user role will lose "Developer" rights and the user role be updated to just "Content Manager".

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Update Existing User Role API Reference document

post.summary: Transfer stack ownership to other users
post.description:
The Transfer stack ownership to other users call sends the specified user an email invitation for accepting the ownership of a particular stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Transfer Stack Ownership API Reference document

requestBody.description:
The Transfer stack ownership to other users call sends the specified user an email invitation for accepting the ownership of a particular stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Transfer Stack Ownership API Reference document

get.summary: Accept stack owned by other user
get.description:
The Accept stack owned by other user call allows a user to accept the ownership of a particular stack via an email invitation.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Accept Stack Ownership API Reference document

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Enter the stack API key.

get.description:
The Get stack settings call retrieves the configuration settings of an existing stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Stack Settings API Reference document

post.description:
The Add stack settings call lets you add settings for an existing stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Stack Settings API Reference document

requestBody.description:
The Add stack settings call lets you add settings for an existing stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Stack Settings API Reference document

post.description:
The Reset stack settings call resets your stack to default settings, and additionally, lets you add parameters to or modify the settings of an existing stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Stack Settings API Reference document

requestBody.description:
The Reset stack settings call resets your stack to default settings, and additionally, lets you add parameters to or modify the settings of an existing stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Stack Settings API Reference document.

post.description:
The Share a stack call shares a stack with the specified user to collaborate on the stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Share Stack API Reference document

requestBody.description:
The Share a stack call shares a stack with the specified user to collaborate on the stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Share Stack API Reference document

post.description:
The Unshare a stack call unshares a stack with a user and removes the user account from the list of collaborators. Once this call is executed, the user will not be able to view the stack in their account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Unshare Stack API Reference document

requestBody.description:
The Unshare a stack call unshares a stack with a user and removes the user account from the list of collaborators. Once this call is executed, the user will not be able to view the stack in their account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Unshare Stack API Reference document

get.description:
The Get all content types call returns comprehensive information of all the content types available in a particular stack in your account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get All Content Types API Reference document

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include in response the total count of content types available in your stack.

post.description:
The Create a content type call creates a new content type in a particular stack of your Contentstack account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Create Content Type API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Create a content type call creates a new content type in a particular stack of your Contentstack account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Create Content Type API Reference document

get.description:
The Get a single content type call returns information of a specific content type.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get Single Content Type API Reference document

parameters.name: include_global_field_schema
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include in response the details of all the fields within the Global field's schema.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

put.summary: Update Content Type | Set Field Visibility Rule for Content Type
put.description:
For more information on the individual requests, click on their respective documentation links below:

And below this line, we'll be providing the documentation links in bulleted list form.

  • Update Content Type
  • Set Field Visibility Rule for Content Type

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

Set Field Visibility Rule for Content Ty.summary: Set Field Visibility Rule for Content Type

delete.description:
The Delete Content Type call deletes an existing content type and all the entries within it.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Delete Content Type API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

post.description:
This multipurpose request allows you to either send a publish request or accept/reject a received publish request.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Publish Request Approval API Reference document

200.description:
This multipurpose request allows you to either send a publish request or accept/reject a received publish request.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Publish Request Approval API Reference document

requestBody.description:
This multipurpose request allows you to either send a publish request or accept/reject a received publish request.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Publish Request Approval API Reference document

get.summary: Get all references of content type
get.description:
The Get all references of content type call will fetch all the content types in which a specified content type is referenced.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Content Type References API Reference document

parameters.name: authtoken
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

get.description:
This call is used to export a specific content type and its schema. The data is exported in JSON format.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Export Content Type API Reference document

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Enter the version of content type you want to retrieve. If no version is specified, you will get the latest version of the content type.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

post.description:
The Import a content type call imports a content type into a stack by uploading JSON file.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Import Content Type API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Import a content type call imports a content type into a stack by uploading JSON file.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Import Content Type API Reference document

example.description: Upload the JSON file of the content type that you want to import.

get.description:
The Get all global fields call returns comprehensive information of all the global fields available in a particular stack in your account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get All Global Fields API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

post.description:
The Create a global field request allows you to create a new global field in a particular stack of your Contentstack account. You can use this global field in any content type within your stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Create Global Field API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Create a global field request allows you to create a new global field in a particular stack of your Contentstack account. You can use this global field in any content type within your stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Create Global Field API Reference document

get.description:
The Get a single global field request allows you to fetch comprehensive details of a specific global field.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get Single Global Field API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

put.description:
The Update a global field request allows you to update the schema of an existing global field.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Update Global Field API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Update a global field request allows you to update the schema of an existing global field.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Update Global Field API Reference document

delete.description:
The Delete global field request allows you to delete a specific global field.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Delete Global Field API Reference document

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Set the force parameter to 'true' to delete the Global field.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

post.description:
The Import a global field call imports a global field into a stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Import Global Field API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Import a global field call imports a global field into a stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Import Global Field API Reference document

example.description: Upload the JSON file of the global field that you want to import.

get.description:
This request is used to export a specific global field and its schema. The data is exported in JSON format.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Export Global Field API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

get.description:
The Get all entries call fetches the list of all the entries of a particular content type. It also returns the content of each entry in JSON format. You can also specify the environment and locale of which you wish to get the entries.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get all Entries API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

post.description:
The Create an entry call creates a new entry for the selected content type.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Create an Entry API Reference document

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Enter the code of the language in which you want your entry to be localized in.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Create an entry call creates a new entry for the selected content type.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Create an Entry API Reference document

get.description:
The Get a single entry request fetches a particular entry of a content type.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get a Single Entry API Reference document

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Enter the version number of the entry that you want to retrieve. However, to retrieve a specific version of an entry, you need to keep the environment parameter blank.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Enter the code of the language of which the entries need to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.

parameters.name: include_workflow
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to include the workflow details of the entry.

parameters.name: include_publish_details
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to include the publish details of the entry.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

put.summary: Update an entry | Localize an entry | PUSH Operation | PULL Operation | UPDATE Operation | ADD Operation | SUB Operation
put.description:
For more information on the individual requests, click on their respective documentation links below:

And below this line, we'll be providing the documentation links in bulleted list form.

  • Update an entry
  • Localize an entry
  • PUSH Operation
  • PULL Operation
  • UPDATE Operation
  • ADD Operation
  • SUB Operation

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Enter the code of the language of which the entry you need to update.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

delete.description:
The Delete an entry request allows you to delete a specific entry from a content type. This API request also allows you to delete single and/or multiple localized entries.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Delete an Entry API Reference document

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Enter the code of the language of which the entry needs to be deleted.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

post.description:
The Set Version Name for Entry request allows you to assign a name to a specific version of an entry.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Entry Version Naming API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Set Version Name for Entry request allows you to assign a name to a specific version of an entry.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Entry Version Naming API Reference document

delete.description:
The Delete Version Name of Entry request allows you to delete the name assigned to a specific version of an entry. This request resets the name of the entry version to the version number.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Entry Version Naming API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

get.summary: Get Details of All Versions of an Entry
get.description:
The Get Details of All Versions of an Entry request allows you to retrieve the details of all the versions of an entry.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Entry Version Naming API Reference document

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enter the number of version details to be skipped.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Enter the maximum number of version details to be returned.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to get the total count of the entry version details.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Enter the code of the language of which the entries need to be included. Only the version details of entries published in this locale will be displayed.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

get.description:
The Get references of an entry call returns all the entries of content types that are referenced by a particular entry.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Entry References API Reference document

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

get.description:
The Get languages of an entry call returns the details of all the languages that an entry exists in.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Entry Languages API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

post.description:
The Unlocalize an entry request is used to unlocalize an existing entry. Read more about Unlocalization.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Unlocalize Entry API Reference document

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Enter the code of the language to unlocalize the entry of that particular language.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Unlocalize an entry request is used to unlocalize an existing entry. Read more about Unlocalization.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Unlocalize Entry API Reference document

get.description:
The Export an entry call is used to export an entry. The exported entry data is saved in a downloadable JSON file.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Export Entry API Reference document

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Enter the code of the language to unlocalize the entry of that particular language.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

post.description:
The Import an entry call is used to import an entry. To import an entry, you need to upload a JSON file that has entry data in the format that fits the schema of the content type it is being imported to.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Import Entry API Reference document

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Enter the code of the language to import the entry of that particular language.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Select 'true' to replace an existing entry with the imported entry file.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Import an entry call is used to import an entry. To import an entry, you need to upload a JSON file that has entry data in the format that fits the schema of the content type it is being imported to.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Import Entry API Reference document

example.description: Upload the JSON file of the entry that you want to import.

post.description:
The Import an existing entry call will import a new version of an existing entry. You can create multiple versions of an entry.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Import Entry API Reference document

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Enter the code of the language to import the entry of that particular language.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Select 'true' to replace an existing entry with the imported entry file.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Import an existing entry call will import a new version of an existing entry. You can create multiple versions of an entry.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Import Entry API Reference document

example.description: Upload the updated JSON file of the entry that you want to import.

post.description:
The Publish an entry request lets you publish an entry either immediately or schedule it for a later date/time.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Publish Entry API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Publish an entry request lets you publish an entry either immediately or schedule it for a later date/time.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Publish Entry API Reference document

post.summary: Publish an entry with references | Publish entries and assets in bulk
post.description:
For more information on the individual requests, click on their respective documentation links below:

And below this line, we'll be providing the documentation links in bulleted list form.

  • Publish an entry with references
  • Publish entries and assets in bulk

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

Publish entries and assets in bulk.summary: Publish entries and assets in bulk

post.description:
The Unpublish an entry call will unpublish an entry at once, and also, gives you the provision to unpublish an entry automatically at a later date/time.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Unpublish Entry API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Unpublish an entry call will unpublish an entry at once, and also, gives you the provision to unpublish an entry automatically at a later date/time.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Unpublish Entry API Reference document

get.summary: Get all assets | Get a single folder by name
get.description:
For more information on the individual requests, click on their respective documentation links below:

And below this line, we'll be providing the documentation links in bulleted list form.

  • Get all assets
  • Get a single folder by name

parameters.name: include_folders
parameters.description: The Get subfolders of a parent folder request retrieves the details of only the subfolders of a specific asset folder. This request does not retrieve asset files.

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: The Get subfolders of a parent folder request retrieves the details of only the subfolders of a specific asset folder. This request does not retrieve asset files.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The Get a single folder by name call retrieves a specific asset folder based on the name provided.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Specify the version number of the asset that you want to retrieve. If the version is not specified, the details of the latest version will be retrieved.

parameters.name: include_publish_details
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to include the publish details of the entry.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: Set this parameter to 'true' to include the total number of assets available in your stack in the response body.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

post.description:
The Upload asset call uploads an asset file to your stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Upload Asset API Reference document

parameters.name: relative_urls
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to display the relative URL of the asset.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Upload asset call uploads an asset file to your stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Upload Asset API Reference document

example.description: Upload the asset file that you want to import.
If needed, assign a parent folder to your asset by passing the UID of the parent folder in this parameter.
Enter a title for your uploaded asset.
Enter a description for your uploaded asset.
Assign specific tags to your uploaded asset.

get.summary: Get assets of a specific folder or sub folder
get.description:
The Get assets of a specific folder retrieves all assets of a specific asset folder; however, it doesn't retrieve the details of subfolders within it.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get Assets of a Specific Folder API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

parameters.name: include_folders
parameters.description: Set this parameter to ‘true’ to include the asset folders in the search query.

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: Enter the UID of the asset folder.

get.description:
The Get an asset call returns comprehensive information about a specific version of an asset of a stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get a Single Asset API Reference document

parameters.name: version
parameters.description:
Specify the version number of the asset that you want to retrieve. If the version is not specified, the details of the latest version will be retrieved.
Note: If no version is mentioned, this request will retrieve the latest published version of the asset. To retrieve a specific version, make use of the version parameter and keep the environment parameter blank.

parameters.name: environment_name
parameters.description: Enter the name of the environment to retrieve assets published on them. You can enter multiple environments.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Enter the name of the environment to retrieve assets published on them. You can enter multiple environments.

parameters.name: include_publish_details
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to include the publish details of the asset.

parameters.name: relative_urls
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to display the relative URL of the asset. This parameter is not applicable when you delete an asset.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

put.summary: Replace asset | Update asset revision | Update asset
put.description:
For more information on the individual requests, click on their respective documentation links below:

And below this line, we'll be providing the documentation links in bulleted list form.

  • Replace asset
  • Update asset revision
  • Update asset

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Enter the name of the environment if you wish to retrieve the assets published on a particular environment. You can enter multiple environments.

parameters.name: relative_urls
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to display the relative URL of the asset. This parameter is not applicable when you delete an asset.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

example.description: Upload the JSON file of the asset that you want to import.
If needed, assign a parent folder to your asset by passing the UID of the parent folder in this parameter.
Enter a title for your uploaded asset.
Enter a description for your uploaded asset.
Assign specific tags to your uploaded asset.

delete.description:

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Delete Asset API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

delete.description:
The Delete Version Name of Asset request allows you to delete the name assigned to a specific version of an asset. This request resets the name of the asset version to the version number.

For more information, refer to the Asset Version Naming API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

get.summary: Get Details of All Versions of an Asset
get.description:
The Get Details of All Versions of an Asset request allows you to retrieve the details of all the versions of an asset.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Asset Version Naming API Reference document

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enter the number of version details to be skipped.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Enter the maximum number of version details to be returned.

parameters.name: named
parameters.description: Set to ‘true’ if you want to retrieve only the named versions of your asset.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to get the total count of the asset version details.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

get.description:
The Get asset references call returns the details of the entries and the content types in which the specified asset is referenced.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Asset Reference API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

get.summary: Get either only images or videos
get.description:
The Get either only images or videos call retrieves assets that are either image or video files, based on query request.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Retrieve Specific Asset Types API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

post.description:
The Publish an asset call is used to publish a specific version of an asset on the desired environment either immediately or at a later date/time.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Publish Asset API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Publish an asset call is used to publish a specific version of an asset on the desired environment either immediately or at a later date/time.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Publish Asset API Reference document

post.description:
The Unpublish an asset call is used to unpublish a specific version of an asset from a desired environment.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Unpublish Asset API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Unpublish an asset call is used to unpublish a specific version of an asset from a desired environment.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Unpublish Asset API Reference document

get.description:
The Get a single folder call gets the comprehensive details of a specific asset folder by means of folder UID.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Asset Folder Collection API Reference document

parameters.name: include_path
parameters.description: Set this parameter to ‘true’ to retrieve the complete path of the folder. The path will be displayed as an array of objects which includes the names and UIDs of each parent folder.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

put.description:
The Update or move folder request can be used either to update the details of a folder or set the parent folder if you want to move a folder under another folder.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Asset Folder Collection API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Update or move folder request can be used either to update the details of a folder or set the parent folder if you want to move a folder under another folder.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Asset Folder Collection API Reference document

delete.description:
The Delete a folder call is used to delete an asset folder along with all the assets within that folder.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Asset Folder Collection API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

post.description:
The Create a folder call is used to create an asset folder and/or add a parent folder to it (if required).

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Asset Folder Collection API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Asset Folder Collection API Reference document

post.summary: Unpublish entries and assets in bulk
post.description:
The Unpublish entries and assets in bulk request allows you to unpublish multiple entries and assets at the same time.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Bulk Unpublish Operation API Reference document

parameters.name: skip_workflow_stage_check
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to publish the entries that are at a workflow stage where they satisfy the applied publish rules.

parameters.name: approvals
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to publish the entries that do not require an approval to be published.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken.

For more information, refer to the Bulk Unpublish Operation API Reference document

For more information, refer to the Bulk Delete Operation API Reference document

For more information, refer to the Bulk Update Workflow Details Operation API Reference document

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken.

For more information, refer to the Custom Fields API Reference document

parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

post.summary: Upload a custom field | Create a custom field with source URL | Create a custom field with source code | Create widget with source URL | Upload Dashboard Widget | Create a Dashboard Widget with Source code
post.description:
For more information on the individual requests, click on their respective documentation links below:

And below this line, we'll be providing the documentation links in bulleted list form.

  • Upload a custom field
  • Create a custom field with source URL
  • Create a custom field with source code
  • Create widget with source URL
  • Upload Dashboard Widget
  • Create a Dashboard Widget with Source code

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

Create a custom field with source URL.summary: Create a custom field with source URL

Create a custom field with source code.summary: Create a custom field with source code

Create a Dashboard Widget with Source co.summary: Create a Dashboard Widget with Source code

example.description: Upload the HTML file of the custom field that you want to upload.
Enter the title of the custom field that you want to upload.
Enter the data type for the input field of the custom field.
Enter the tags that you want to assign to the custom field.
Enter “true” if you want your custom field to store multiple values
Enter type as “field”, since this is a custom field extension.

get.summary: Get all widgets | Get widgets of a content type
get.description:
For more information on the individual requests, click on their respective documentation links below:

And below this line, we'll be providing the documentation links in bulleted list form.

  • Get all widgets
  • Get widgets of a content type

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Enter the UID of the content type of which you want to retrieve the details of all the applicable widgets

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Parameter for custom widgets.

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

put.description:
The Update a widget request is used to update the details of a widget.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Custom Widgets API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

requestBody.description:
The Update a widget request is used to update the details of a widget.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Custom Widgets API Reference document

extension.title: Widget Updated
extension.src: Enter either the source code or the external hosting link of the widget depending on the hosting method you selected.

delete.summary: Delete multiple items from a Release
delete.description:
The Delete multiple items from a Release request deletes one or more items (entries and/or assets) from a specific Release.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Release Items API Reference document

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

post.description:
The ‘Set a fallback language’ request allows you to assign a fallback language for an entry in a particular language.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Fallback Languages API Reference document

parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

post.summary: Create Content Type with Extension Field | Create a content type
post.description:
For more information on the individual requests, click on their respective documentation links below:

And below this line, we'll be providing the documentation links in bulleted list form.

  • Create Content Type with Extension Field
  • Create a content type

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

Create Content Type with Extension Field.summary: Create Content Type with Extension Field

limit.name: limit
limit.description: The ‘limit’ parameter will return a specific number of entries in the output. Example, if there are 10 organizations and you wish to fetch only the first 2, you need to specify '2' as the value in this parameter.

skip.name: skip
skip.description: The ‘skip’ parameter will skip a specific number of organizations in the output. Example, if there are 12 organizations and you want to skip the first 2 to get only the last 10 in the response body, you need to specify ‘2’ here.

asc.name: asc
asc.description: The ‘asc’ parameter allows you to sort the list of organizations in the ascending order with respect to the value of a specific field.

desc.name: desc
desc.description: The ‘desc’ parameter allows you to sort the list of Organizations in the descending order with respect to the value of a specific field.

include_count.name: include_count
include_count.description: The ‘include_count’ parameter returns the total number of organizations related to the user. Example: If you wish to know the total number of organizations, you need to mention ‘true’.

typeahead.name: typeahead
typeahead.description: The typeahead parameter is a type of filter that allows you to perform a name-based search on all organizations based on the value provided. Example, if we have four organizations named ‘ABC’, ‘ABC1’, ‘XYZ’, and ‘ACC’, and we provide ‘ABC’ as the value to this parameter, the search result will return the organizations ‘ABC’ and ‘ABC1’ as the output.

include_plan.name: include_plan
include_plan.description: The include_plan parameter includes the details of the plan that the organization has subscribed to. To include the details of the subscribed plan in the Response body, enter ‘true’.

include_stack_roles.name: include_stack_roles
include_stack_roles.description: The ‘include_stack_roles’ parameter, when set to ‘true’, includes the details of stack-level roles in the Response body.

include_roles.name: include_roles
include_roles.description: The ‘include_roles’ parameter, when set to ‘true’, will display the details of the roles that are assigned to the user in an organization.

include_invited_by.name: include_invited_by
include_invited_by.description: The ‘include_invited_by’ parameter, when set to ‘true’, includes the details of the user who sent out the organization invitation.

include_user_details.name: include_user_details
include_user_details.description: The ‘include_user_details’ parameter, when set to ‘true’, lets you know whether the user who has been sent the organization invitation has enabled Two-factor Authentication or not.

include_collaborators.name: include_collaborators
include_collaborators.description: Set this parameter to 'true' to include the details of the stack collaborators.

include_stack_variables.name: include_stack_variables
include_stack_variables.description: Set this to 'true' to display the stack variables. Stack variables are extra information about the stack, such as the description, format of date, format of time, and so on. Users can include or exclude stack variables in the response.

include_discrete_variables.name: include_discrete_variables
include_discrete_variables.description: Set this to 'true' to view the access token of your stack.

include_global_field_schema.name: include_global_field_schema
include_global_field_schema.description: Set this to 'true' to include in response the details of all the fields within the Global field's schema.

authorization.name: authorization
authorization.description: For this call we recommend you to use management token.

version.name: version
version.description: Enter the version of the content type of which you want to retrieve the details. If no version is specified, you will get the latest version of the content type.

force.name: force
force.description: Enter 'true' to force delete a content type.

include_global_fields.name: include_global_fields
include_global_fields.description: Set the include_global_fields parameter to “true” to retrieve all the Global fields in which the specified content type is referenced.

overwrite.name: overwrite
overwrite.description: Select 'true' to replace the existing content type with the imported content type file.

locale.name: locale
locale.description: Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.

include_workflow.name: include_workflow
include_workflow.description: Enter 'true' to include the workflow details of the entry.

include_publish_details.name: include_publish_details
include_publish_details.description: Enter 'true' to include the publish details of the entry.

delete_all_localized.name: delete_all_localized
delete_all_localized.description: Set the "delete_all_localized" parameter to "true" to delete all the localized versions of the entry.

named.name: named
named.description: Set to ‘true’ if you want to retrieve only the named versions of your entry.

approvals.name: approvals
approvals.description: Set this to “true” to publish the entries that do not require an approval to be published.

x-bulk-action.name: x-bulk-action
x-bulk-action.description: Pass “publish” as the value of this parameter in order to publish an entry with all references.

skip_workflow_stage_check.name: skip_workflow_stage_check
skip_workflow_stage_check.description: Set this to “true” to publish the entries that are at a workflow stage where they satisfy the applied publish rules.

folder.name: folder
folder.description: Enter either the UID of a specific folder to get the assets of that folder, or enter ‘cs_root’ to get all assets and their folder details from the root folder.

include_folders.name: include_folders
include_folders.description: Set this parameter to ‘true’ to include the details of the created folders along with the details of the assets.

environment_name.name: environment_name
environment_name.description: Enter the name of the environment to retrieve the assets published on them. You can enter multiple environments.

environment.name: environment
environment.description: Enter the name of the environment to retrieve the assets published on them. You can enter multiple environments.

relative_urls.name: relative_urls
relative_urls.description: Set this to 'true' to display the relative URL of the asset.

asc_field_uid.name: asc_field_uid
asc_field_uid.description: Enter the unique ID of the field for sorting the assets in ascending order by that field.

desc_field_uid.name: desc_field_uid
desc_field_uid.description: Enter the unique ID of the field for sorting the assets in descending order by that field.

include_path.name: include_path
include_path.description: Set this parameter to ‘true’ to retrieve the complete path of the folder. The path will be displayed as an array of objects which includes the names and UIDs of each parent folder.

count.name: count
count.description: The ‘count’ parameter works similar to the ‘include_count’ parameter but returns ONLY the total count of releases in your stack and not the details of the releases in the response. Example: If you want to know the total number of releases in your stack, you need to mention ‘true’ as value for this parameter.

include_items_count.name: include_items_count
include_items_count.description: The ‘include_items_count’ parameter returns the total number of items in a specific release. Example: If you want to know the total number of items in a release, you need to mention ‘true’ as the value of this parameter.

content_types.name: content_types
content_types.description: Enter a comma-separated list of content type UIDs for filtering publish rules on its basis.

action.name: action
action.description: Enter the action that has been set in the Publishing Rule.

sort.name: sort
sort.description: Enter the field UID on the basis of which you want to sort your tasks. Example: {"assigned_at": "desc"}, {"content_type": "asc"}, or {"assigned_date": "desc", "locale":"asc"}

include_permissions.name: include_permissions
include_permissions.description: Set this parameter to 'true' to include the details of the permissions assigned to a particular role.

include_rules.name: include_rules
include_rules.description: Set this to ‘true’ to include the details of the rules assigned to a role.
